column4: I've got a question, did dual-boot Ubuntu over an XP Media Center install, used the Ubuntu partition resize in install and now XP won't boot, the std grub entry doesn't work, GRUB doesn't recognize the filesystem type
I can mount the XP partition and read all the files no problem, so it's still there
and that works...it's what I'm on now ;-)
the sda2 is a rescue image that HP ships on its systems, it's there and will boot and run actually but panics doing a rescue because it assumes partitioning that I have changed
I can paste the whole thing if you like, the rest is the normal Ubuntu stuff in sda3
if I try to directly chainload a file say /$Boot it says, cannot mount filesystem
I think I actually have to buy XP and just re-install
conf files are funny. one , instead or . and anarchy
That is a link to the older file?
the only diff with that and one of the boxes that works, installed the same way is they have root, and not rootnoverify, which doesn't work on this one
That looks like mine. But the mechanism ill be final arbitor on booting. all decisions are final and irrevocable. period. - lol
yeah I think I caught a bug in parted, it's not something I'm new to and I've driven myself insane for a week trying anything I could find
Reading through some arcania i stumbled upon the penguin sleuth kit and the app "testdisk". - haven't needed it yet but glad it's there.
I think I need to restore the windows boot record, which means a re-install for me, then again I may just say screw it and only use the work laptop Win when I need it
the fun part is the only things I own that require Windows are a Logitech remote and a GPS and only for updating, pain in the ass
